text:
Hello everyone,

Is there a solution to use the email address on <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/marketing-email/how-do-i-customize-my-email-opt-out-page|the email preferences page >to attach an unsubscribe reason to a contact?
*`{{ personalization.tokens }}`* do not work on that system page.

The contact email address is always masked on that screen due to GDPR ( which was not the case a couple of years ago ).

How can we possibly detect the email address of the contact on that step?


â€¢ <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Email-Marketing-Tool/How-to-add-a-question-about-an-unsubscribe-reason-on-the/m-p/333894/highlight/true#M4119|Related community post ( outdated, though )>

Any ideas?

Hello everyone! I would like to ask if it is possible to change the order of the blog posts on pages like /blog/page/2 etc. I don't want them to be in order of publication, but in the order of a date field that I have put in an internal module of the post, so I would take it with content.widget etc.


cc the great <@U01QVR44MEY>
I mean you could create your own listing template and just do a for loop to sort your posts. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/blog#listing-pagination>
oh cool so this print the pages? :smile:
sorry I meant to go to this section: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/blog#listing-page-templates>
If you want the JSON format, just remove "pprint" from the line.
In fact, I will remove it from my script above now.
